the king of england was very powerful
very brave and full of resolution
he had distinguished himself in many a

boldness in all his campaigns
as regards his kingdom and rank he was

the enemy heard that several bodies had

various districts through which the
germans proposed to march
the franks therefore resolved to come

were not expecting the attack
but they became the sport of the vain

people saw them coming out in order of

from his lair the sultan sprang to his

for islam
the sultan had just left his tent when i

as anxious as a mother who has lost her
only son he ordered his drum to be

everyone was now on the saddle but by

the whole of the right wing was already

the fight was maintained without

the whole ground between our camp and

mounted on my mule i passed through a

i noticed the bodies of two women
someone told me that he had seen four

it was indeed a bitter day for the

some say eight thousand others seven i

he replied so far there are
4060 odd
winter had now come on and the sea was

therefore the sultan permitted his

letters came in from akka beseeching us

therefore informed his troops that he

nevertheless they bore up with

meanwhile the sultan never ceased

the two sides were still engaged in

the news of his coming spread great

leaders had often times boasted to us

the people of the city were worn out by

the following morning our people went

he was also anxious to set about the
